intro: Jacobaea gnaphalioides, commonly known as the common tansy, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant features finely divided, fern-like leaves and produces yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. It is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of habitats, including roadsides and meadows. Jacobaea gnaphalioides is also known for its strong, aromatic scent and has been used historically in herbal medicine.
